summary: Implemented ARM CLI MVP (local-only) with Typer commands status/validate/plan/release/rollback. Added git subprocess adapter for tags/log/diff and dirty-tree checks, Conventional Commits parser+validator, SemVer bump calculation, Markdown changelog generation (prepend), zip packager (stdlib zipfile), transaction log writer (.arm/last_release.json), and rollback executor. Added unit tests and a dry-run integration test that asserts zero side effects.

acceptance_criteria_mapping.criterion: arm validate returns exit 0 for compliant commits and exit 2 with a list of offending commits otherwise.
acceptance_criteria_mapping.evidence: validate_commits implemented; CLI exits with code 2 on validation errors (covered by unit tests for error collection).

acceptance_criteria_mapping.criterion: arm plan deterministically prints next version + changelog preview without side effects.
acceptance_criteria_mapping.evidence: arm plan reads git log, validates, computes bump, renders preview; no filesystem writes.

acceptance_criteria_mapping.criterion: arm release --dry-run has zero side effects (no file changes, no commit/tag, no dist artifact, no .arm write).
acceptance_criteria_mapping.evidence: tests/test_integration_dry_run.py asserts no CHANGELOG.md, no .arm, no dist, and clean git status after dry-run.

acceptance_criteria_mapping.criterion: arm release (non-dry) updates CHANGELOG.md, optionally commits and tags, and produces a zip artifact in dist/.
acceptance_criteria_mapping.evidence: Implemented behavior; not yet covered by integration test in this round.

acceptance_criteria_mapping.criterion: arm rollback reverts the last release using .arm/last_release.json: deletes tag, reverts changelog commit (or hard reset if --hard), deletes artifacts listed.
acceptance_criteria_mapping.evidence: Implemented rollback executor; not yet covered by integration test in this round.

known_issues: This project directory itself is not a git repository; integration tests create a temp git repo to validate behavior.
release/rollback non-dry paths are implemented but lack integration coverage in this round (unit coverage exists for supporting pieces).
Tag parsing assumes tags are of the form <prefix><semver> (e.g., v1.2.3); non-semver tags matching prefix may raise during plan/release.
risks: Rollback safety depends on correct transaction log contents; further integration tests recommended for tag deletion and revert behavior.
Packager exclude-globs are basic; glob semantics may need refinement for edge cases (nested patterns).
